result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Kera D. Skibba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Entry of Judgment Withheld on Count 1 (no paper document) - Count 1 will be dismissed if the defendant successfully completes probation

Defendant Kera D. Skibba n/k/a Larson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today for sentencing are 15CF252, 16CF177, 16CF337 and 14CM374 and for a plea/sentencing is 14CF353.  All charges in 15CF253 and 16CF185 were DRI.

2:12 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State indicates that an amended information had been filed. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF353 (State files an amended information for Count 1):
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 (PAC .292) - Dismissed 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 on 14CF353 and Count 3 is dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification.  Atty Knaapen indicates it is uncertain as to what case the victim is associated with.
Atty Sheets would ask that the Court disregard the letter from the "victim" as a victim impact statement.
The Court has reviewed the letter from Ms Anderson and makes statements on the record.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
3:08 p.m.  Court is in a 5 minute recess.
3:14 p.m.  Court is back in session.
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF252:
Count 1 -
Withhold entry of judgment 
**If defendant successfully completes probation, Count 1 will be dismissed 
**If defendant is revoked from probation, judgment of conviction would be entered on Count 1 and the defendant would return to court for sentencing on that count 
**Granted 6 days of jail credit if judgment is entered 

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - concurrent 
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probations 
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 14CF353
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge 

Count 5 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - concurrent to Count 2 
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probations 
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 14CF353
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CF177:
Count 1 -
Withhold entry of judgment and hold this matter open while the defendant is on probation on the other cases
**If the defendant successfully completes probation, this charge will be dismissed
**If the defendant is revoked, judgment of conviction would be entered on this  count and the defendant would return to court for sentencing

16CF337:
Count 1 -
Withhold entry of judgment and hold this matter open while the defendant is on probation on the other cases
**If the defendant successfully completes probation, this charge will be dismissed
**If the defendant is revoked, judgment of conviction would be entered on this  count and the defendant would return to court for sentencing
**Granted 2 days of jail credit if judgment is entered 

Count 6 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - consecutive to any other sentence 
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probations 
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 14CF353

14CM374:
Count 1 -

Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probations 
**Conditions of Probation:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 14CF353

14CF353:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 6 month jail sentence - consecutive to any other sentence 
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent with other probation's 
**Conditions of Probation:
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Take prescribed medications as prescribed from a physician
*Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy
*Sign all necessary releases so agent can verify compliance 
*Maintain or obtain full-time employment 
*Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons while on probation
No contact either direct or indirect with D Lettau or R Christensen their residence or places of employment
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done so 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge 

Count 2 -
360 days of jail 
Eligible for huber priviliges
Court will leave it up to the jail admininstration and risk assessment to determine the eligibility of the defendant for GPS electronic home monitor
Parties will determine the number of days of jail credit
Sentence to commence immediatly
Pay fine and costs totalling $6008
Pay blood draw of $26.45
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.
36 month DL revocation
36 month IID 
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

Count 3 - Dismissed

Defendant Kera D. Skibba in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Knaapen indicates that there had been a plea agreement but there are some medical concerns of the defendant and they will be requesting and adjournment.
